item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "...And talking of the dear family party which would then be restored, of their mutual pursuits and cheerful society, as the only happiness worth a wish." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Colleen Down
item.description: "I personally have my own idea of an efficient house. It would be totally concrete with a big drain in the middle, a large fiberglass tree for my kids to swing from and a hose hanging in the corner." -- Colleen Down

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by John Taylor Gatto
item.description: "When you take the free will out of education, that turns it into schooling." -- John Taylor Gatto

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "One's work may be finished someday, but one's education never." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "So what? All writers are lunatics!" -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "If you take a book with you on a journey," Mo had said when he put the first one in her box, "an odd thing happens: The book begins collecting your memories. And forever after you have only to open that book to be back where you first read it. It will all come into your mind with the very first words: the sights you saw in that place, what it smelled like, the ice cream you ate while you were reading it... yes, books are like flypaper—memories cling to the printed page better than anything else." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "It's a good idea to have your own books with you in a strange place" -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "I prefer a story that has the good sense to stay on the page where it belongs. - Elinor" -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Because fear kills everything," Mo had once told her. "Your mind, your heart, your imagination." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you secruity and friendship and didn't ask for anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly. " -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Mo could paint pictures in the empty air with his voice alone." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Richard De Bury Translated by E.C.Thomas
item.description: "In books I meet the dead as if they were alive, in books I see what is yet to come... All things decay and pass with time... all fame would fall victim to oblivion if God had not given mortal men the book to aid them." -- Richard De Bury Translated by E.C.Thomas

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Louise L. Hay
item.description:
"You have the power to heal your life, and you need to know that. We think so often that we are helpless, but we're not. We always have the power of our minds…Claim and consciously use your power.
" -- Louise L. Hay

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Louise L. Hay
item.description: "I am in the right place, at the right time, doing the right thing." -- Louise L. Hay

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Louise L. Hay
item.description: "I have never understood the importance of having children memorize battle dates. It seems like such a waste of mental energy. Instead, we could teach them important subjects such as How the Mind Works, How to Handle Finances, How to Invest Money for Financial Security, How to be a Parent, How to Create Good Relationships, and How to Create and Maintain Self-Esteem and Self-Worth. Can you imagine what a whole generation of adults would be like if they had been taught these subjects in school along with their regular curriculum?" -- Louise L. Hay

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language." -- Henry James

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "Some mothers in today's world feel "cumbered" by home duties and are thus attracted by other more "romantic" challenges. Such women could make the same error of perspective that Martha made. The woman, for instance, who deserts the cradle in order to help defend civilization against the barbarians may well later meet, among the barbarians, her own neglected child." -- Neal A. Maxwell

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I have heard there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead and some come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready you see. Now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You can be smart and happy or stupid and miserable. . . it's your choice" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Shiloah add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "It is both relaxing and invigorating to occasionally set aside the worries of life, seek the company of a friendly book...from the reading of 'good books' there comes a richness of life that can be obtained in no other way." -- Gordon B. Hinckley
